de.esoco.lib.logging

Class LogAspect<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.logging.LogAspect<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MailLogging, StreamLogging

    public abstract class LogAspect<T>
extends org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
    This is a base class for the implementation of specific aspects of logging, like logging to a database or external systems. The common property of aspects implemented with this class is that they need to synchronize access to the logging back-end through a shared resource like a socket or a database connection.

    Log aspects can or sometimes must be configured by setting relation types on the corresponding instance. Some standard configuration types are already defined in this base class:

    • MIN_LOG_LEVEL
    • MIN_STACK_LOG_LEVEL
    • MAX_LOGGING_ERRORS

    MIN_STACK_LOG_LEVEL must be evaluated by subclasses, the other configurations are handled by this base class. It is recommended that subclasses always contain a no-argument constructor and perform their initialization in the init() method from the configuration relations. They may also offer additional parameterized constructors.

    The generic parameter defines the type of log message object that is used by an implementation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Integer> MAX_LOGGING_ERRORS
      A configuration value that defines the maximum number of errors that may occur before this log aspect is disabled and an error is logged with the logging framework.

      The minimum log level to be logged by this aspect.
      static org.obrel.core.RelationType<LogLevel> MIN_STACK_LOG_LEVEL
      The minimum log level to be logged by this aspect that shall include the execution stack (default: LogLevel.ERROR).

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_LOG_LEVEL

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<LogLevel> MIN_LOG_LEVEL
        The minimum log level to be logged by this aspect. Will be initialized with Log.getGlobalMinimumLogLevel() if not set explicitly.

      • MIN_STACK_LOG_LEVEL

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<LogLevel> MIN_STACK_LOG_LEVEL
        The minimum log level to be logged by this aspect that shall include the execution stack (default: LogLevel.ERROR).

      • MAX_LOGGING_ERRORS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Integer> MAX_LOGGING_ERRORS
        A configuration value that defines the maximum number of errors that may occur before this log aspect is disabled and an error is logged with the logging framework. Default value is 0 (zero), i.e. logging will be shutdown on the first error.

    • Method Detail

      • initLogging

        public final void initLogging()
        Initializes the logging of this aspect. Multiple invocations of this method will be ignored.

      • shutdownLogging

        public final void shutdownLogging()
        Stops the logging of this aspect. Multiple invocations of this method will be ignored.

        Returns the simple name of this aspect's class.
        Overrides:

      • createLogObject

        protected abstract T createLogObject(LogRecord rLogRecord)
        Must be implemented by subclasses to create an implementation-specific log data object from a LogRecord instance.
        Parameters:
        rLogRecord - The log record to convert
        Returns:
        The implementation log object

      • processLogObjects

        protected abstract void processLogObjects(java.util.Collection<T> rLogObjects)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be implemented by subclasses to process a collection of log data objects in an implementation-specific way, e.g. by sending them to another system or store them in a database. The given collection will always contain at least one object. Multiple objects should always be process in the iteration order of the collection and the collection must not be modified by the implementation. The objects in the collection have all been created by createLogObject(LogRecord).

        Implementations may throw any kind of exception. The log aspect base implementation will perform a generic error handling by shutting down the aspect logging and logging a FATAL message. The implementation must still perform any cleanup of acquired resources if necessary.

        Parameters:
        rLogObjects - The log objects to process
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the processing fails

      • getLogInitMessage

        protected java.lang.String getLogInitMessage()
        Returns a message that will be logged as info message after initialization of this aspect.
        Returns:
        The log init message (NULL for none)

      • init

        protected void init()
        Will be invoked from initLogging(). Can be implemented by subclasses to initialize the internal state that is needed for the operation of this aspect. The default implementation does nothing.

      • shutdown

        protected void shutdown()
        Will be invoked from shutdownLogging(). Can be implemented by subclasses to perform a cleanup of resources that had been acquired in init() or during logging. The default implementation does nothing.
